roleset.name: continue

example.name: keep on truckin'
example.text: He predicted that the most popular growth companies will be those with ``some kind of unique product or franchise'' that makes [them]-1 appear able *trace*-1 to sustain their momentum.

example.name: non agentive sustainer
example.text: Treasury officials have been arguing for months that the dollar's strength was out of whack with economic fundamentals, threatening to extinguish the export boom that [*T*] has sustained manufacturers for several years.

roleset.note: SUSTAIN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'sustain' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet. Comparison with 'continue'. (from sustain.01-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: suffer (a loss)

example.name: oh, the tragedy
example.text: Richard Rifenburgh, chairman and chief executive of the Longmont, Colo., disk-drive maker, also said [the company]-1 continued losing money in the third quarter and expects *trace*-1 to sustain further losses through the end of the year.
example.arg: through the end of the year.

roleset.note: SUSTAIN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'sustain' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet. Comparison with 'continue'. (from sustain.02-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: able to be continued

example.name: arg1
example.text: This is also an important reason why economists have warned that China 's current growth pattern is not sustainable .

roleset.note: SUSTAINABLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-7. Relation to 'sustain.01'. (from sustainable.01-j)

roleset.name: able to be suffered (losses)

example.name: arg1
example.text: Although these financial losses were sustainable, the reputational loss was not, and a bank's reputation is right up there with its bottom line.

roleset.note: SUSTAINABLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-7. Relation to 'sustain.01'. (from sustainable.02-j)
